trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Clarizen | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Clarizen | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Clarizen with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Clarizen with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Clarizen.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Clarizen.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Clarizen single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Clarizen single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Clarizen will be able to single sign into the application at your Clarizen company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Clarizen will be able to single sign into the application at your Clarizen company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Clarizen
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Clarizen

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Clarizen.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Clarizen.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Clarizen.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Clarizen.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Clarizen, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Clarizen, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Clarizen</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Clarizen</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Clarizen with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Clarizen with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Clarizen application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Clarizen application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Clarizen page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Clarizen page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Clarizen page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Clarizen page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Clarizen company site as an administrator (e.g.: https://app2.clarizen.com/Clarizen/Pages/Service/Login.aspx).
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Clarizen company site as an administrator (e.g.: https://app2.clarizen.com/Clarizen/Pages/Service/Login.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Click your user name, and then click Settings.
trans-unit.target: Click your user name, and then click Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Global Settings tab, and then, next to Federated Authentication, click edit.
trans-unit.target: Click the Global Settings tab, and then, next to Federated Authentication, click edit.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Global Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Global Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Federated Authentication dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Federated Authentication dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Federated Authentication</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Federated Authentication</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Upload to upload your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Click Upload to upload your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Clarizen dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Sign-in URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Clarizen dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Sign-in URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-out at Clarizen dialog page, copy the Single Sign-Out Service URL value, and then paste it into the Sign-out URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-out at Clarizen dialog page, copy the Single Sign-Out Service URL value, and then paste it into the Sign-out URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Select Use POST.
trans-unit.target: Select Use POST.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Clarizen, they must be provisioned into Clarizen.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Clarizen, they must be provisioned into Clarizen.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Clarizen, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Clarizen, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Clarizen company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Clarizen company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click People.
trans-unit.target: Click People.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>People</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>People</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Invite User.
trans-unit.target: Click Invite User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Invite Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Invite Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Invite People dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Invite People dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Invite People</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Invite People</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Email textbox, type the email address of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the Email textbox, type the email address of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Invite.
trans-unit.target: Click Invite.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Active Directory account holder will receive an email and follow a link to confirm their account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Active Directory account holder will receive an email and follow a link to confirm their account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Clarizen **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Clarizen **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
